issue.title: [BUG] OSError when installing Rosetta version of Julia on M1 machine
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When I install the Rosetta version of Julia (not compiled natively to M1/ARM CPUs), I see this error after running `pysr.install()`:
```python
OSError: dlopen(/Applications/Julia-1.7.app/Contents/Resources/julia/lib/libjulia.1.7.dylib, 0x000A): tried: '/Applications/Julia-1.7.app/Contents/Resources/julia/lib/libjulia.1.7.dylib' (mach-o file, but is an incompatible architecture (have 'x86_64', need 'arm64e'))
```

**Version (please complete the following information):**
- OS: macOS 12.3.1, with Apple M1 Pro
- Version: v0.9.0-1
- Does the bug appear with the latest version of PySR? Yes

nodes.body: One solution seems to be to set up the entire environment with `arch -x86_64 python ...`, but it would require you to build a new python env. I guess mixing the x86_64 version of Julia and an arm64 version of Python might just not be possible...?
Okay there's actually a native version of Julia for M1 - scroll down to https://julialang.org/downloads/#upcoming_release (will add to README).
